New Records: India won by 7 wickets with 19.3 overs to spare, moving to the top of the table and extending their unbeaten World Cup record against Pakistan to 8-0 in ODIs
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma hammered 86 off 63 balls with six fours and six sixes, putting on a 42-bal 56 stand with Virat Kohli and then a 71-ball 77 stand with Shreyas Iyer to completely take the game away from Pakistan
Shreyas Iyer smashed 53 off 62 balls to take India home
Pakistan's collapse saw them lose 8 for 36, which India capitalized on to win the match
Pre-Game Insights: Experts were expecting a close contest, but India's bowlers inflicted a stunning collapse that saw Pakistan lose 8 for 36
Pakistan's only way back was early wickets, but Rohit Sharma came out like a man on a mission
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma praised his bowlers, saying 'the bowlers today as well set the game for us. Restricting them to 190 was a great effort'
Babar Azam said Pakistan started well but couldn't finish well, and that the total was not good
Jasprit Bumrah said he analyzed the wicket as soon as possible and knew the wicket was on the slower side so the hard lengths were the way
Miscellaneous Highlights: India's win was their third in a row, and they moved to the top of the table
Rohit Sharma's innings was an outstanding one, and he put on a 42-bal 56 stand with Virat Kohli and then a 71-ball 77 stand with Shreyas Iyer
Shreyas Iyer's 53 off 62 balls was a crucial contribution in India's win
Jasprit Bumrah's slower ball to Mohammad Rizwan will be talked about for years to come
Others: India's win was their 8th against Pakistan in ODIs, and they have now won 3 matches in a row in the World Cup
The match was played at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad, and the toss was won by India, who elected to field first
